thread.title: Foran cleared: NRL rules on return date
thread.title_full: Foran cleared: NRL rules on return date

title: Foran cleared: NRL rules on return date
text:
NRL clears Kieran Foran to resume his career with New Zealand Warriors in round three February 15, 2017 1:33pm @jimmyhooper Source: FOX SPORTS THE NRL has cleared suspended Kiwi Test star Kieran Foran to return to the playing field with the New Zealand Warriors in round three. 
Foran has satisfied the NRL’s integrity unit that he is a fit and proper person and will be available for Warriors coach Stephen Kearney against Canterbury-Bankstown in round three. 
The decision finally gives a firm date for Foran to combine with Shaun Johnson, Issac Luke and new skipper Roger Tuivasa-Sheck in what is arguably the most lethal spine in the competition. 
The NRL released the following statement at 1.10pm: “The NRL said today it has registered the contract of Kieran Foran to play with the New Zealand Warriors. 
“However, Foran will not be permitted to play until round three and his return is subject to a further psychological assessment to ensure he is in the right frame of mind to play in the NRL.” 
NRL CEO Todd Greenberg and Warriors Managing Director Jim Doyle said they had worked closely over the last four months on a rehabilitation program to help Foran overcome the problems which saw him drop out of the game last year. Manu Vatuvei and Kieran Foran train together in the gym. Source: Instagram 
“I have always said that my priority is ensuring Kieran’s wellbeing — and his football career is secondary,” Greenberg said. 
“The expert advice we recently received indicates that Kieran’s recovery has reached the point where he is physically and mentally fit to return to rugby league. 
“Consequently, we have today registered his contract to play with the Warriors in 2017. 
“However, we want to be doubly sure that Kieran is in the right state of mind and have therefore decided to defer his return to the NRL until round three so a further psychological assessment can be made. 
“Kieran will only be allowed to play again in the NRL if that assessment is positive. Conditions will also be placed on his contract relating to integrity matters following the review of his gambling associations last year.” 
Doyle said Foran had made significant progress since joining the Warriors last year and the club continues to provide internal and external support. 
“Naturally, we are keen to see Kieran back on the field as soon as possible but we have always shared the NRL’s view that the most important thing is to ensure Kieran is mentally and physically ready for the demands of the NRL,” Doyle said. Kieran Foran watches the Auckland Nines from the stands with Shaun Johnson. Source: Getty Images 
“We have seen Kieran’s progress over the last few months and we are confident he will be ready for round three. 
“Kieran has already become an integral part of the Warriors squad off the field and his team mates will be thrilled to see him back on the field.” 
Foran said he was delighted that his contract had been registered. 
“Naturally I would love to return in round one because I love rugby league and I love being part of the Warriors squad,” he said. 
“But both the Warriors and NRL have put my welfare first throughout so I am just happy that my contract is registered and I now have a date for my return.” 
Foran walked out on a four-year $4.8 million contract with the Parramatta Eels last year amid a raft of personal issues. 
The Kiwi Test star publicly admitted to battling depression and was also under immense scrutiny for his relationship with high-profile punter Eddie Hayson. 
Foran, who is coming off a shoulder reconstruction, opted to move away from Sydney and return to New Zealand last year. 
The NRL has since refused to register the Kiwi Test pivot’s contract for the past four months while closely monitoring Foran’s mental health. 
The governing body is now satisfied Foran is ready to return in round three but his contract will still contain a number of integrity issues attached to it. 
Foran will be available for selection for the Warriors round three clash against the Bulldogs in the Fox League Friday night footy clash at Dunedin’s Forsyth Barr Stadium on March 17. 
The match is a Canterbury-Bankstown home game the Bulldogs have opted to take to New Zealand.
